meanings.definition: Swelling caused by excess fluid trapped in body tissues.
meanings.sent1: The oedema in her ankle made it difficult for her to walk.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed the patient with oedema in his legs.
meanings.sent3: Despite the oedema in his face, he still managed to crack a smile.
meanings.sent4: The oedema in the room was palpable, as if the walls were swelling with water.
meanings.sent5: The oedema in the flower petals gave them a bloated appearance.

meanings.definition: An abnormal accumulation of fluid in the intercellular spaces of the body.
meanings.sent1: The oedema in her hands caused them to look puffy.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained that the oedema was due to a kidney problem.
meanings.sent3: The oedema in the balloon animal made it look like a strange creature.
meanings.sent4: The oedema in the jar of pickles made them appear swollen and ready to burst.
meanings.sent5: The oedema in the sponge soaked up all the excess water in the sink.
